00005 """Xcode-ninja wrapper project file generator.
00006 
00007 This updates the data structures passed to the Xcode gyp generator to build
00008 with ninja instead. The Xcode project itself is transformed into a list of
00009 executable targets, each with a build step to build with ninja, and a target
00010 with every source and resource file.  This appears to sidestep some of the
00011 major performance headaches experienced using complex projects and large number
00012 of targets within Xcode.
00013 """
00014 
00015 import errno
00016 import gyp.generator.ninja
00017 import os
00018 import re
00019 import xml.sax.saxutils
00020 
00021 
00022 def _WriteWorkspace(main_gyp, sources_gyp, params):
00023   """ Create a workspace to wrap main and sources gyp paths. """
00024   (build_file_root, build_file_ext) = os.path.splitext(main_gyp)
00025   workspace_path = build_file_root + '.xcworkspace'
00026   options = params['options']
00027   if options.generator_output:
00028     workspace_path = os.path.join(options.generator_output, workspace_path)
00029   try:
00030     os.makedirs(workspace_path)
00031   except OSError, e:
00032     if e.errno != errno.EEXIST:
00033       raise
00034   output_string = '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\n' + \
00035                   '<Workspace version = "1.0">\n'
00036   for gyp_name in [main_gyp, sources_gyp]:
00037     name = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(gyp_name))[0] + '.xcodeproj'
00038     name = xml.sax.saxutils.quoteattr("group:" + name)
00039     output_string += '  <FileRef location = %s></FileRef>\n' % name
00040   output_string += '</Workspace>\n'
00041 
00042   workspace_file = os.path.join(workspace_path, "contents.xcworkspacedata")
00043 
00044   try:
00045     with open(workspace_file, 'r') as input_file:
00046       input_string = input_file.read()
00047       if input_string == output_string:
00048         return
00049   except IOError:
00050     # Ignore errors if the file doesn't exist.
00051     pass
00052 
00053   with open(workspace_file, 'w') as output_file:
00054     output_file.write(output_string)
00055 
00056 def _TargetFromSpec(old_spec, params):
00057   """ Create fake target for xcode-ninja wrapper. """
00058   # Determine ninja top level build dir (e.g. /path/to/out).
00059   ninja_toplevel = None
00060   jobs = 0
00061   if params:
00062     options = params['options']
00063     ninja_toplevel = \
00064         os.path.join(options.toplevel_dir,
00065                      gyp.generator.ninja.ComputeOutputDir(params))
00066     jobs = params.get('generator_flags', {}).get('xcode_ninja_jobs', 0)
00067 
00068   target_name = old_spec.get('target_name')
00069   product_name = old_spec.get('product_name', target_name)
00070   product_extension = old_spec.get('product_extension')
00071 
00072   ninja_target = {}
00073   ninja_target['target_name'] = target_name
00074   ninja_target['product_name'] = product_name
00075   if product_extension:
00076     ninja_target['product_extension'] = product_extension
00077   ninja_target['toolset'] = old_spec.get('toolset')
00078   ninja_target['default_configuration'] = old_spec.get('default_configuration')
00079   ninja_target['configurations'] = {}
00080 
00081   # Tell Xcode to look in |ninja_toplevel| for build products.
00082   new_xcode_settings = {}
00083   if ninja_toplevel:
00084     new_xcode_settings['CONFIGURATION_BUILD_DIR'] = \
00085         "%s/$(CONFIGURATION)$(EFFECTIVE_PLATFORM_NAME)" % ninja_toplevel
00086 
00087   if 'configurations' in old_spec:
00088     for config in old_spec['configurations'].iterkeys():
00089       old_xcode_settings = \
00090         old_spec['configurations'][config].get('xcode_settings', {})
00091       if 'IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET' in old_xcode_settings:
00092         new_xcode_settings['CODE_SIGNING_REQUIRED'] = "NO"
00093         new_xcode_settings['IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET'] = \
00094             old_xcode_settings['IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET']
00095       ninja_target['configurations'][config] = {}
00096       ninja_target['configurations'][config]['xcode_settings'] = \
00097           new_xcode_settings
00098 
00099   ninja_target['mac_bundle'] = old_spec.get('mac_bundle', 0)
00100   ninja_target['ios_app_extension'] = old_spec.get('ios_app_extension', 0)
00101   ninja_target['ios_watchkit_extension'] = \
00102       old_spec.get('ios_watchkit_extension', 0)
00103   ninja_target['ios_watchkit_app'] = old_spec.get('ios_watchkit_app', 0)
00104   ninja_target['type'] = old_spec['type']
00105   if ninja_toplevel:
00106     ninja_target['actions'] = [
00107       {
00108         'action_name': 'Compile and copy %s via ninja' % target_name,
00109         'inputs': [],
00110         'outputs': [],
00111         'action': [
00112           'env',
00113           'PATH=%s' % os.environ['PATH'],
00114           'ninja',
00115           '-C',
00116           new_xcode_settings['CONFIGURATION_BUILD_DIR'],
00117           target_name,
00118         ],
00119         'message': 'Compile and copy %s via ninja' % target_name,
00120       },
00121     ]
00122     if jobs > 0:
00123       ninja_target['actions'][0]['action'].extend(('-j', jobs))
00124   return ninja_target
00125 
00126 def IsValidTargetForWrapper(target_extras, executable_target_pattern, spec):
00127   """Limit targets for Xcode wrapper.
00128 
00129   Xcode sometimes performs poorly with too many targets, so only include
00130   proper executable targets, with filters to customize.
00131   Arguments:
00132     target_extras: Regular expression to always add, matching any target.
00133     executable_target_pattern: Regular expression limiting executable targets.
00134     spec: Specifications for target.
00135   """
00136   target_name = spec.get('target_name')
00137   # Always include targets matching target_extras.
00138   if target_extras is not None and re.search(target_extras, target_name):
00139     return True
00140 
00141   # Otherwise just show executable targets.
00142   if spec.get('type', '') == 'executable' and \
00143      spec.get('product_extension', '') != 'bundle':
00144 
00145     # If there is a filter and the target does not match, exclude the target.
00146     if executable_target_pattern is not None:
00147       if not re.search(executable_target_pattern, target_name):
00148         return False
00149     return True
00150   return False
00151 
00152 def CreateWrapper(target_list, target_dicts, data, params):
00153   """Initialize targets for the ninja wrapper.
00154 
00155   This sets up the necessary variables in the targets to generate Xcode projects
00156   that use ninja as an external builder.
00157   Arguments:
00158     target_list: List of target pairs: 'base/base.gyp:base'.
00159     target_dicts: Dict of target properties keyed on target pair.
00160     data: Dict of flattened build files keyed on gyp path.
00161     params: Dict of global options for gyp.
00162   """
00163   orig_gyp = params['build_files'][0]
00164   for gyp_name, gyp_dict in data.iteritems():
00165     if gyp_name == orig_gyp:
00166       depth = gyp_dict['_DEPTH']
00167 
00168   # Check for custom main gyp name, otherwise use the default CHROMIUM_GYP_FILE
00169   # and prepend .ninja before the .gyp extension.
00170   generator_flags = params.get('generator_flags', {})
00171   main_gyp = generator_flags.get('xcode_ninja_main_gyp', None)
00172   if main_gyp is None:
00173     (build_file_root, build_file_ext) = os.path.splitext(orig_gyp)
00174     main_gyp = build_file_root + ".ninja" + build_file_ext
00175 
00176   # Create new |target_list|, |target_dicts| and |data| data structures.
00177   new_target_list = []
00178   new_target_dicts = {}
00179   new_data = {}
00180 
00181   # Set base keys needed for |data|.
00182   new_data[main_gyp] = {}
00183   new_data[main_gyp]['included_files'] = []
00184   new_data[main_gyp]['targets'] = []
00185   new_data[main_gyp]['xcode_settings'] = \
00186       data[orig_gyp].get('xcode_settings', {})
00187 
00188   # Normally the xcode-ninja generator includes only valid executable targets.
00189   # If |xcode_ninja_executable_target_pattern| is set, that list is reduced to
00190   # executable targets that match the pattern. (Default all)
00191   executable_target_pattern = \
00192       generator_flags.get('xcode_ninja_executable_target_pattern', None)
00193 
00194   # For including other non-executable targets, add the matching target name
00195   # to the |xcode_ninja_target_pattern| regular expression. (Default none)
00196   target_extras = generator_flags.get('xcode_ninja_target_pattern', None)
00197 
00198   for old_qualified_target in target_list:
00199     spec = target_dicts[old_qualified_target]
00200     if IsValidTargetForWrapper(target_extras, executable_target_pattern, spec):
00201       # Add to new_target_list.
00202       target_name = spec.get('target_name')
00203       new_target_name = '%s:%s#target' % (main_gyp, target_name)
00204       new_target_list.append(new_target_name)
00205 
00206       # Add to new_target_dicts.
00207       new_target_dicts[new_target_name] = _TargetFromSpec(spec, params)
00208 
00209       # Add to new_data.
00210       for old_target in data[old_qualified_target.split(':')[0]]['targets']:
00211         if old_target['target_name'] == target_name:
00212           new_data_target = {}
00213           new_data_target['target_name'] = old_target['target_name']
00214           new_data_target['toolset'] = old_target['toolset']
00215           new_data[main_gyp]['targets'].append(new_data_target)
00216 
00217   # Create sources target.
00218   sources_target_name = 'sources_for_indexing'
00219   sources_target = _TargetFromSpec(
00220     { 'target_name' : sources_target_name,
00221       'toolset': 'target',
00222       'default_configuration': 'Default',
00223       'mac_bundle': '0',
00224       'type': 'executable'
00225     }, None)
00226 
00227   # Tell Xcode to look everywhere for headers.
00228   sources_target['configurations'] = {'Default': { 'include_dirs': [ depth ] } }
00229 
00230   sources = []
00231   for target, target_dict in target_dicts.iteritems():
00232     base = os.path.dirname(target)
00233     files = target_dict.get('sources', []) + \
00234             target_dict.get('mac_bundle_resources', [])
00235     for action in target_dict.get('actions', []):
00236       files.extend(action.get('inputs', []))
00237     # Remove files starting with $. These are mostly intermediate files for the
00238     # build system.
00239     files = [ file for file in files if not file.startswith('$')]
00240 
00241     # Make sources relative to root build file.
00242     relative_path = os.path.dirname(main_gyp)
00243     sources += [ os.path.relpath(os.path.join(base, file), relative_path)
00244                     for file in files ]
00245 
00246   sources_target['sources'] = sorted(set(sources))
00247 
00248   # Put sources_to_index in it's own gyp.
00249   sources_gyp = \
00250       os.path.join(os.path.dirname(main_gyp), sources_target_name + ".gyp")
00251   fully_qualified_target_name = \
00252       '%s:%s#target' % (sources_gyp, sources_target_name)
00253 
00254   # Add to new_target_list, new_target_dicts and new_data.
00255   new_target_list.append(fully_qualified_target_name)
00256   new_target_dicts[fully_qualified_target_name] = sources_target
00257   new_data_target = {}
00258   new_data_target['target_name'] = sources_target['target_name']
00259   new_data_target['_DEPTH'] = depth
00260   new_data_target['toolset'] = "target"
00261   new_data[sources_gyp] = {}
00262   new_data[sources_gyp]['targets'] = []
00263   new_data[sources_gyp]['included_files'] = []
00264   new_data[sources_gyp]['xcode_settings'] = \
00265       data[orig_gyp].get('xcode_settings', {})
00266   new_data[sources_gyp]['targets'].append(new_data_target)
00267 
00268   # Write workspace to file.
00269   _WriteWorkspace(main_gyp, sources_gyp, params)
00270   return (new_target_list, new_target_dicts, new_data)
